content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a 3 row table, with 7 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x.” The heading for row 2 is “f prime of x.” The heading for row 3 is “f double prime of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. 0 is less than x, is less than 5. f prime of x is positive. f double prime of x is positive. Column 2. x equals 5. f prime of x is undefined. f double prime of x is undefined. Column 3. 5 is less than x, is less than 8. f prime of x is negative. f double prime of x is negative. Column 4. x equals 8. f prime of x is negative 2. f double prime of x is 0. Column 5. 8 is less than x, is less than 12. f prime of x is negative. f double prime of x is positive. Column 6. x equals 12. f prime of x is 0. f double prime of x is 0. Column 7. 12 is less than x, is less than 16. f prime of x is positive. f double prime of x is positive." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0em" columnwidth="3.5em 0.05em 5.5em 5.5em 5.5em 3.5em 5.5em 3.5em 5.5em " equalrows="false" frame="solid" framespacing="0em 0ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="0.05em" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>8</mn></mtd><mtd><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>8</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>12</mn></mtd><mtd><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>12</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>16</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mtext>Positive</mtext></mtd><mtd><mtext>Undefined</mtext></mtd><mtd><mtext>Negative</mtext></mtd><mtd><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mtd><mtd><mtext>Negative</mtext></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mtext>Positive</mtext></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mtext>Positive</mtext></mtd><mtd><mtext>Undefined</mtext></mtd><mtd><mtext>Negative</mtext></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mtext>Positive</mtext></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mtext>Positive</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is continuous on the interval <math alttext="open parenthesis, 0 comma 16, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is twice differentiable except at <math alttext="x equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> where the derivatives are undefined. Information about the first and second derivatives of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for values of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the interval <math alttext="open parenthesis, 0 comma 16, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is given in the table above. At what values of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the interval <math alttext="open parenthesis, 0 comma 16, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> does the graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> have a point of inflection?

choices.label: <math alttext="x equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x equals 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="x equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x equals 12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="x equals 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x equals 12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="x equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x equals 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 5.8: Sketching Graphs of Functions and Their Derivatives

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
